explanation:

This suggests that any changes would occur in later segments. There is no indication in this segment that the first square of the second row was changed. Since the question is about the changes to the first square of the second row, and there's no evidence of it being altered in these segments, we can eliminate options that suggest changes occurred. </think>
<answer>Z</answer>

<think>
At [2-12], the man kicks the ball to the first square of the second row, changing it to an orange cross. Then, the woman kicks the ball to the same square, changing it back to a blue circle. Later, the man kicks the ball again to the same square, changing it back to an orange cross. Finally, the woman kicks the ball once more, restoring the blue circle. This sequence shows that the first square of the second row was changed four times. Earlier segments do not mention any changes to this square, so the changes all occur within this segment. The dense caption confirms these actions, supporting the count of changes. Thus, Option A ("Four times") is the correct answer.
